Five cross-country skiers found dead in Switzerland, AFP reportsFive cross-country skiers were found dead in Switzerland and a search is still on for a sixth skier, AFP reported on Monday, citing police. US-bound ship from Reliance's Sikka port hits BPCL crude import facility, sources sayOil tanker Hafnia Seine bound for the United States from Sikka port in Western India hit Bharat Petroleum Corp's (BPCL) crude import facility in an accident late on Sunday, two sources with the knowledge of the matter said on Monday. South Korea deploys military, public doctors to strike-hit hospitalsSouth Korea will start deploying military physicians and doctors from public health centres to strike-hit hospitals on Monday to help care for patients affected by the walkout of nearly 12,000 trainee doctors from 100 hospitals over government reform plans. China trying to 'normalise' military drills near Taiwan, island's top security official saysTaiwan's top security official told parliament on Monday that China runs "joint combat readiness patrols" near the democratic island every 7-10 days on average, saying Chinese forces were trying to "normalise" drills near Taiwan. Mon, 11 Mar 2024 02:48:53 GMT 7Q7GIMPQFJKGJEI7334JB23CKE https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/china-trying-normalise-military-drills-near-taiwan-islands-top-security-official-2024-03-11/Reuters世界亚太地区
Australian writer sentenced to death in China may never be executed, says Chinese ambassadorChina's ambassador to Australia said on Monday that the suspended death sentence given last month to imprisoned Australian writer Yang Hengjun may not be carried out if the former pro-democracy blogger commits no further crimes.
